alert.note: Alert for Central Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 15 at 1:22AM AKST until February 16 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow with low visibility and wind chills to 55 below. East winds gusting to 35 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times in blowing snow. * WHERE...Central Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Snow drifts will form. Very cold wind chills to 55 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East winds of 20 mph will gust to 35 mph tonight through Thursday. This will cause blowing and drifting snow with periods of low visibility. This will also cause wind chills of 35 to 55 below.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
